etymology.description: 匸 (enclosed space) + 品 (many people) = many people within an enclosure -> area, district
etymology.interpretation: The character 區(區) (qū, 'district') visually represents an area where many people reside, symbolized by 品(品) (pǐn, 'goods/people') enclosed within 匸(匸) (xì, 'enclosure'). This layout effectively conveys the idea of a defined space containing a community or district.
etymology.simplification: 區(區) was simplified to 区(區) by reducing 品(品) to 乂(乂) (yì, 'to manage'), keeping the enclosure meaning while reducing strokes.

examples.chinese: 我住在繁华的区(我住在繁華的區)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài fán huá de qū.
examples.english: I live in a bustling district.

examples.chinese: 古代文人常在这区(古代文人常在這區)，寻觅灵感(尋覓靈感)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ dài wén rén cháng zài zhè qū, xún mì líng gǎn.
examples.english: Ancient literati often sought inspiration in this region.

examples.chinese: 他参观了多个区(他參觀了多個區)，体验了不同的文化(體驗了不同的文化)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cān guān le duō gè qū, tǐ yàn le bù tóng de wén huà.
examples.english: He visited several districts and experienced diverse cultures.
